[b][color=white]Witza Offline[/color][/b]
On August 27th, someone managed to create DNS changes for both HackForums and Witza. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] fixed the issue shortly after finding it. A few users have reported a deface of the site, and couldn't access it for the day. No information was stolen and all sensitive data is secure. You can read [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4417712][b]Witza Offline[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]New Award Available for Purchase[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has added a new award called "Legalize It" with the description of, "If you're in support of legalizing cannabis you can obtain this award with a $50 BTC purchase. 25% of all donations get sent to NORML.org." You can only pay for the award with $50 worth of BTC. If you would like to purchase the award, visit this link, [url]http://hackforums.net/legalize.php[/url]. You can read more of [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4421184][b]Legalize It Award[/b][/url] for more information. 

[b][color=white]W4TCHL2ST Still on the Lookout[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url], the leader of the HFNT, is still looking for members to join the Writ3rs. There are a few requirements including being an Ub3r member. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url] also requires members to have excellent grammar, spelling, and dedication to be a part of the team. Applicants must also have knowledge of the current happens going on all over HackForums. If you would like to apply for the team, go the the recruitment thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4202284]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Post Junks and Post Recounting[/color][/b]
On September 12th,  the site was down for about 45 minutes due to  maintenance. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] cleared the junk forums, deleted some users, and did a post recount. There were approximately one million posts deleted. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has made a thread talking about the recent junks and talks about a server upgrade. He has also made a [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet/status/510500766096715776] [b]tweet[/b][/url] on the [url=https://twitter.com/HackForumsNet][b]Official Twitter[/b][/url] of HackForums. You can read more about the junks and server specs in [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4443559][b][News] Prunes and Post Count[/b][/url]. 

[b][color=white]New Donator Award[/color][/b]
There was a new awarded added to the site. This award, named "Grand Amethyst", is a new donation award. This award is a one time purchase with the cost of $1,000. As of September 12th, four members have purchased this award. You can find those users [url=http://hackforums.net/myawards.php?awid=80][b]here[/b][/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] also talks about changing a few things with older awards. A few of the members who did donate were competing to see who would be the first to get the award. There is a possibility that Master Donator will become a one time purchase of $500. You can read more in [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4439274][b]Grand Amethyst Award[/b][/url], where he talks about the possible award changes. 

[b][color=white]Polymath's Polybot[/color][/b]
The official group, Polymath, created an AI chatbot that has hidden codes members can find to unlock prizes. Prizes ranged from membership upgrades to group invites. This contest was held on September 10th and ended on September 11th. The [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4440769][b]first thread[/b][/url] was closed after 1,600 replies that caused it to glitch out. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=42927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Lani[/b][/color][/url] made a new thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4441684][b]here[/b][/url], that was closed with about 730 posts. You can read through the event, what the prizes were, and who won the prizes in [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=42927][color=#EFEFEF][b]Lani's[/b][/color][/url] thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4441684][b]Polymath | AI Chatbot [Polybot] | Part 2[/b][/url].

[b][color=white]Two New Groups![/color][/b]
During the HF News' absence, two new groups have made an appearance on the frontier. Both "The Revolution" and "Titans" were converted from previous groups, featuring three new leaders each and attempting to cover ground that others before have not. Only time will tell how they turn out, but until then, you can find their recruitments [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4452939]Here[/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4457585]Here[/url], respectively.

[b][color=white]Group Sale Frenzy![/color][/b]
With The Empire now being sold this marks the third group to up for sale in the last month, next to Infamous and Fly By Night. With these many groups we can sure expect a lot more creative ideas spawning. Not just from the group owners but from the people in these new born groups. Fly By Night has become [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4437063][b]Specialist[/b][/url] and Infamous is slowly transforming into [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4428458][b]Titans[/b][/url]. We wish the new leaders of these groups the best of luck, so that they may strive to provide much more back to the HackForums community.

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Welcome to this week's edition of the HF news, Soulmate. Anything you wanna say before we start this interview off?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color] No thanks, let's get into it.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] What's your deal with corgis? Why are you so obsessed with them?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color] I wouldn't say im obsessed, but back when I playing Xbox live my group of friends really liked them at the time so I would always talk about them as well. Then a few years ago me and my friend made co
corgi twitter accounts to post pictures and try to entertain people and now it just seems natural for everyone to know how much I like them.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] What about your username, what's so special about it and why'd you choose it?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color]  I chose it because I entered a gametag giveaway and got the gamertag Soulmate so I changed my alias to it completely. This was about 3 years ago when I had first joined HF so at the time I still had 
the option to change the name I went by. My old username was Ninetales, which was also a gamertag I used to own.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  What's your opinion on HF nowadays? Would you still recommend it to someone you know?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color]  I don't think HF is as good as it used to be due to the marketplace and the change in the value of gamertags. Back when I was a salesman there anyone could get a cheap tag and resell it then keep making money, but these days is a lot harder. I wouldn't recommend the forum to any of my friends currently since it's very harsh on new members and it takes quite a while to get used to everyone.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Still, can see yourself browsing this forum sometime in the future?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color]  I think I'll be able to stay on HF to browse for a few years but it's hard to imagine being as active as I once was.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Why are you still l33t after all these years?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color] I've been denied ub3r since the end of 2011, I'm not sure exactly why but I may be because I was in Haunter Gang. At the time I also only posted in the gamertags section so my posts may have been low 
quality to some extent and I've been permanently denied since about 2012.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Ah well. You have a massive amount of posts in the gamertag section, do you still frequent there? 
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b][/color]   I haven't been on there for over a year, mostly because I know people will either have really bad tags or won't show the tag in the thread. It's really boring now compared to a few years ago.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Very true. Anything else you'd like to say before we're done with this interview?
[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php=action=profile&uid=837416]Soulmate[/url]:[/b] I would like to give a shoutout to Saturday and Top, as well as everyone else who has been my friend on HF over the years. Thank you for supporting me.
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605]Nivarka[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the 207th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Nivarka. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to start off with a shout-out to Vinnie, - Sam -, Package, Greatest, Based God Tyrone, Aceman, I Will Mashinate, Saturday and Abide. Not to forget the biggest shout-out of all to Package's bald nan.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] To those reading who may not be familiar, Package is an Instinct member who has long been the butt of many jokes by group members. How much, if any, of the jokes aimed at Package do you think are justified?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] Far, far too few. Every new initiate is actively encouraged to engage in (questionably) friendly banter with the group mascot. We all throw jokes around and you've got to be able to recieve just as much as you give. Package knows that, which makes the whole thing brilliant.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Fair enough. You are currently a member of another group, the re-birth of Void (L'appel du vide). Is there a similar type of member or mascot among the ranks over there?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] No, simply put. Instinct is a fun, relaxed and light-hearted group, with a few core members who actively play League of Legends together on a regular basis. Void is currently a larger group, with a totally different focus. Joking doesn't fit within the Void subforum. The discussion over there is very intellectual, if you can't hold yourself in a high-level discussion some of the members will destroy you and without a single chuckle.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] That makes perfect sense. I never had the opportunity to join Void though their group's focus on knowledge and science (among other things) go along with who I am and what I'm about. How about you though? Do you find yourself as a very well-educated young man who enjoys and can hold their own in intelligent conversations?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I very much enjoy the discussions on politics and morality, as well as some of the religious discussions. However, I am one to refrain from posting unless I feel that my post would be a quality contribution to the topic, so I do a lot of lurking. I wouldn't say I'm well-educated but I am more than happy to research interesting topics. I can hold my own but sometimes find it difficult, for instance when one states their opinion as fact.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Religion is a very touchy subject and one in which people are very passionate. As such, their opinions and statements are said with such conviction. Do you find yourself as a very religious person or do you have other feelings/views?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I find myself to be anti-theist. That being said, I respect other's beliefs and will never tell someone that they're wrong, only that I believe something different. I'm anti-theist for a number of reasons. I find the fact that individuals invest so much, and in some cases rely on a deity for the entirety of their self worth to be both saddening and mentally damaging. Religion is also linked very heavily with most of the world's conflict, to no apparent gain.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I have very similar views though there's no need to discuss them here. Let's switch gears to talk about your HF career or experience, whatever you'd like to call it. You went from a fairly normal member to something much more in a very short of time. What do you attribute most of this to?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] It was around the middle of this year that I really started frequenting HF again. I decided to open a Currency Exchange service, from which I feel I became a trusted member of the community rather quickly. From then, I was picked up by Vinnie to join Instinct out of the blue. I very quickly bonded with the group and I now work closely with Vinnie both in and outside of the group. This has enabled me to relinquish just a small proportion of my recent earnings towards status upgrades such as Master Donator. And no, for the record Omni, I am not Acroz (despite your suspicions).

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] The HF community certainly needs people to keep stepping up to fill the holes left by other, highly respected and active members, leaving. It seems to be a popular trend these days as well. Being 17 right now, what do you perceive your future being here on the site in five years' time?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I'd love to increase my presence in the 'inner-circles' of HackForums, as well as continue my activity in Instinct, the group that has really built my foundations. I can certainly still see myself on HF in 5 years time as I am planning on entering the cyber security industry. I would certainly love to attain a role such as Mentor, whereby I could help other members and enforce a high quality standard of posting.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] The best way to become a Mentor is to be very active in the Rules/Announcements/Feedback forum. Do you currently have a job or any other obligations limiting your time you can spend on HF aside from schooling?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I'm sure every skid on this forum would say the same, but I genuinely find that my income online is more than enough to sustain a very nice quality of life at this moment in time. In regards to obligations, I spend a lot of my time with my girlfriend of nearly two years. Of course, she's not really an obligation. Contrary to many Instinct members' belief, I do voluntarily give up my time. Other than that, I'm your standard stay-at-home skinny white boy.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] What sort of hobbies do you have outside of your regular work or home duties? I see you are quite active in the WoW forum so I take it you're a gamer of sorts, correct?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] My activity in the WoW section ceased a while ago. I've spent around seven years actively playing high level WoW, and at one point I was the highest ranked PvE rogue on my server. Most of my activity was from a stickied sales thread selling discounted WoW game time. Nowadays, I play mainly League of Legends and occasionally dabble in other games, but all strictly on PC.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] Are there any other types of games you enjoy playing? There are many gamers who do not partake in the occassional shooter though it is quite uncommon. Do you enjoy any shooters or anything else?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I do sometimes play Battlefield 4, however I much prefer strategy, turn-based, simulation, role-playing and MOBA games. Some of my favourites are Heros of Might and Magic III, Civilization V, Sim City, ARMA III and of course, League of Legends. ARMA is my favourite shooter game as it is much more of a realistic military shooter than any of the small, cage-match third person shooters. Heck, I mainly role-play ARMA on the 'life' servers.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] There are certainly a wide variety of topics to have a good conversation with you, Nivarka. Is there any topic or anything else of interest we did not touch upon today that you would like to bring up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I'm passionate about music, if that's something you'd take an interest in.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] With that in mind I will ask you a final question before we close our conversation. What about music do you enjoy the most and which genre(s) do you listen to most often?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] I enjoy the emotion and clarity of expression that rock and metal music offer. On a personal level, there are a few artists, such as Black Stone Cherry, Shinedown and Bullet for My Valentine that truly manage to captivate the way I feel through their music. On the other hand, I own one of the largest Royalty Free Music channels on YouTube, specialising in Electronic Dance Music, which is really fun to produce and makes for great backing music whilst working. For anyone interested, that channel is AudioPad.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952870][color=#2E64FE][b]Alien:[/b][/color][/url] I can't say I share your taste in music but everyone is different when it comes to that. It's been very interesting talking to you this evening. I hope you feel the same and can reach your goals both on and off HF as you move on. Thank you for your time and enjoy the rest of your day!
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692605][color=#EFEFEF][b]Nivarka:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks to both Alien and the readers for giving up their time to learn a little more about me. It's been a pleasure, and I hope to see and encounter each and every one of you around the forum. Until next time... Business As Usual!
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273]Krixus[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 207th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Krixus. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] I would like to shout out my first and only group; Instinct.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] How do you like Instinct? What made you want to join the group?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Well considering I've never been in a group before, it was just an experience that I wanted to try. After applying and being accepted I found out it's really just a big group full of a bunch of pretty cool guys, and everyone in the group is a major gamer, which is a thing I'm pretty fond of.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] What games do you play?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Well personally I'm more of an MMO/MMORPG gamer. I like games like World of Warcraft, Guild Wars 2, Star Wars The Old Republic, and every now and then a little bit of DayZ or Dead Island for my zombie killing addiction.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Nice! Are there any upcoming games you're looking forward to?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] The new World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor expansion is something I'm really looking forward to. Dead Island 2 is coming out sometime next year I think, and that's one of my favorite series of gaming. Also Dragon Age: Inquisition is coming out in November, and I don't know anyone who doesn't love some good ole' fashioned Dragon Age.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] So have you always been a PC gamer? Why do you choose PC over console gaming?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Back in my younger days I was more of a console gamer, I played the Xbox 360 like it was my job, but over time I've just grown acustom to PC gaming because I feel it has more of an advantage, more options, and overall better gameplay. I can up my graphics, or lower them to the way I want to play, and then there's the fact that you can't play MMORPG's on most consoles. I can't live without my MMO's lol.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I'm considering a gaming PC next, I really wanna give it a try. So what do you do outside of the forum? Have any fun hobbies you'd like to share?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] You should give it a try! The only bad part about it, is that a gaming PC will empty your wallet out, but in the end it's really worth it to be able to play ANY game at max graphics you know? Regarding my hobbies, honestly I'm more of a relaxed guy, most of my hobbies include going out with a couple friends, hanging out and relaxing. The most active thing I really do is skateboard a little bit, but I feel like I'm growing out of it as I get older.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I've priced a few out, I'm more nervous about building it. I used to skate when I was younger, but switched to snowboarding. So how did you find Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Building it is the easier part, you could always look around for some tutorials on it, or even ask me for help after the interview! I found Hack Forums like most of everyone else that played Xbox 360. "How to boot people offline?" Haha, it's bad to say but that's honestly how I found it. Afterwards I found out it's really a cool commmunity with a lot of cool members, so I decided to stay and I'm glad I did. I've learned a lot, and met a lot of really great members.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I feel like at least 1/4 of the forum has come for that reason. So how do you like being l33t? Any chance you might join the blue crew in the near future?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Being l33t is okay, I'm definitely glad I bought the upgrade. I've actually applied for Ub3r twice now, and have been denied both times. I feel like I need to step up my game and start being HQ rather than posting a bunch of non-sense. Hopefully in the near future when I apply I will be accepted. I can only hope it goes that way!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] If you had the chance, what would be the first thing you would change on site?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not sure exactly, but I think I would try to figure out a way to prevent scammers and scamming. It's sad seeing people getting scammed out of their hard earned money. I've personally never had it happen to me, but I've seen my friends get scammed. If we all put our thoughts together we could easily figure a way to prevent it or stop it from happening all together.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] It's sad to see newer members especially get taken advantage of, it's disgusting that people do it. How would you rate your overall Hack Forums experience on a scale of 1-10?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] Yes I agree, it makes the whole community look bad. I would probably rate it a 9/10. Hack Forums is obviously something I enjoy quite a bit. There's just some things that could be changed to make it a better experience for everyone.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I think that's all the time I have for this interview, time to go out and enjoy the rest of my vacation. Are there any final remarks you'd like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2134273][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krixus:[/b][/color][/url] I would like to thank you for giving me this opportunity, and also wish you the best on your vacation. Have a good one!
[/spoiler]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=600771]Vinnie[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Hack Forums "Defaced" by Egyptian Hackers[/color][/b]
Hack Forums, the most popular and active hacking forum in the world was "defaced" by a fairly known Egyptian hacker who goes by the handle [i]Eg-R1z[/i], whose Zone-H archive can be found [url=http://www.zone-h.org/archive/notifier=Eg-R1z]here[/url]. DNS changes were made to the registrar without the owner, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]'s approval. Hack Forums and Witza were both affected by this. However, all of this was fixed within a matter of hours from the time it occured. The downside to all of this was that the DNS took it's sweet time to propagate for some members, this lasted for a few hours. On the upside the servers were altered so that they could bypass the CDN, all data is 100% secure and nothing was compromised. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]'s statement can be found [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4417712]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Apple Fixes Issue which Resulted in Celebrity Nude Photo Leaking[/color][/b]
Apple has announced that their programming team will be fixing the security breach which lead to the leaking of several nude photos of various Hollywood celebrities. According to Apple, the issue was caused by a virus under the title "iBrute" which exploited a vulnerability on the "Find my iPhone" application. It is believed that the aforementioned virus enabled the attackers to brute force password combinations in order to gain access to private celebrity photos. Around a hundred nude photos of celebrities such as Jennifer Lawrence, Cara Delevingne and Jessica Brown Findlay were leaked and posted on 4chat, according to Apple's report.

[b][color=white]Hackers Being Right - Sony PSN Network Vulnerable to DDoS Attacks[/color][/b]
Last week there was a series of DDoS attacks targeting large gaming companies and their servers, specifically; Riot Games (League of Legends), Blizzard (Battle.net) and Sony's PlayStation Network. While Riot Games and Blizzard were able to mitigate the DDoS attacks early, Sony was not that lucky and had its services shut down by the large-scale DDoS attack. The company has released a formal statement notifying that sensitive data such as user credentials, credit cards etc. are safe. However, one of the hackers responsible for the attack, released a statement in which he expresses his disappointment with Sony and the fact that the Japanese company has done nothing in order to prevent or mitigate such attacks.

[b][color=white]The End of MSN Messenger[/color][/b]
After Microsoft's purchase of Skype for the astronomical amount of $8.5 billion, the company has initiated the process which will result in the termination of the MSN Messenger, which was later known as Windows Live Messenger. The service, although not running anymore in many countries, is still running in China and is expected to be ending there as well in October 31. After 15 years of providing this service, Microsoft has decided to switch it globally to Skype, a better and modern service. 

[b][color=white]Google Releases Stable 64-bit Version of Chrome[/color][/b]
Google has finally released the long awaited 64-bit stable version of Google Chrome, the browser for Windows operating systems. Google has been working on the 64-bit version for Windows 7 & 8 since June 2014 but have only recently released the latest 64-bit update. Back in June Google first released the Google Chrome 64-bit only in the browsers development and Canary channels; later in July the beta channel received the same update, and now the Google Chrome 64-bit is available in the stable channel.

[i]The new and updated 64-bit version of Google Chrome offers three main updates[/i]
[list][*]Faster speed
[*]Higher security
[*]Better stability[/list]

[color=white][b]Microsoft Releases Faulty Patch[/b][/color]
On the 27[size=xx-small]th[/size] of August, Microsoft reissued a security patch to the previous update of Windows that caused machines to suffer from the Blue Screen Of Death. Microsoft released the patch for the previous faulty patch almost 2 long weeks after the reports emerged. The faulty patch identified as [b]MS14-045[/b] was supposed to fix Windows kernel vulnerabilities in 47 of Microsoft's systems which the company marked as "important". This faulty patch caused users’ machines to force crash and reboot.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]space[/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/i1QkwoE.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=649674]Eternal.[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1079277]Harlem[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1698590]Abide[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]T-Mobile Expands LTE Program “Music Freedom”[/color][/b]
T-Mobile has been busy implementing new incentives to join their network, one of them being “Music Freedom”. Music Freedom allows users of T-Mobile’s LTE network to listen to music on select services without affecting their LTE data limits. T-mobile has enabled the use of the following programs since its launch in June without causing a dent in LTE bandwidth: Spotify, Rhapsody, iTunes Radio, iHeart Radio and Slacker Radio. New Programs added to Music Freedom this week include: Grooveshark, Black Planet, AccuRadio, Radio Paradise, Rdio and Songza. 

[b][color=white]OnePlus One to Open Doors October 2014[/color][/b]
As of right now you can only get a OnePlus One Android smartphone via invite. OnePlus plans to open its doors to more users via a pre-order system as many consumers are frustrated with the invite only system they are currently utilizing. The original release date was planned for September, but OnePlus stated that October is a more likely release date. They do, however, say that it is possible that it will be delayed even further.

[b][color=white]A Wild Nexus 9 has Been Spotted! (Benchmarks)[/color][/b]
Earlier this week the benchmark program known as AnTuTu ran a benchmark for an upcoming and unannounced tablet, the Nexus 9. According to the benchmark the Nexus 9 will be released by HTC, and it will be more powerful than its predecessors by quite a leap. The specs are as follows: Android L, 2.5GHz 64 bit Tegra K1 processor with 5GB of Ram, a 8 MP rear facing Camera with a 2 MP front facing camera and a 9000 mAh battery. This is the most powerful mobile device to date in regards to tablets and phones, and is expected to be announced in Fall according to [i]The Cult of Android[/i].

[b][color=white]Intel's 8-core Haswell-E[/color][/b]
Intel’s new “fast desktop CPU” has come to life. Originally a rumor in March, many people have been very curious to see how Intel’s i7-5960X performs. The base clock of Intel’s recently launched “Devil’s Canyon” processor is 4.0GHz and can be overclocked with ease to 4.4GHz. However, Intel’s i7-5960X (Haswell Extreme Edition) base clock is 3.0GHz with a max speed of 3.5GHz. For gamers, clock speeds are generally more important than cores, so this comes as a disappointment.  While this processor might not be the best for gamers, it does has DDR4 support and eight cores that make 4K video processing and 3D rendering very fast and simple. The $1,000 price tag is quite hefty, but those who need the power of 8 cores will most likely invest in it.

[b][color=white]Tesla to Open up 400 EV Charging Stations Across 120 Chinese Cities[/color][/b]
The electric car craze is even bigger in China than it is in the USA. The main issue electric cars face is that there are not many available charging stations. Tesla decided to make a change to their infrastructure to support the huge demand for electric cars in China. Over 400 charging stations will be built across multiple Chinese cities thanks to a deal signed between Tesla and China Unicom. This electric car craze will help the country with their serious pollution problems, and help China become more environmentally friendly. This is expected to cause yet another boost in Tesla electric car sales, and if the charging stations are successful, more will likely be built.

[b][color=white]MSN Messenger to be Retired in October[/color][/b]
Finally, Microsoft’s MSN Messenger will be shut down for good. After over 15 years, MSN Messenger will be retired and integrated with Skype by October 31st. MSN Messenger has been retired for over a year in the USA, but was left open in China were it was still popular. All users who are still using the service were notified of the change via Hotmail. Microsoft originally created MSN Messenger back in 1999 to compete against AOL’s AIM chat service, and AIM was still more popular until Skype came around. Now, Skype is one of the most popular chatting services on the Internet.

[b][color=white]Apple's Highly Anticipated Wearable not to Drop Until 2015[/color][/b]
Apple is preparing for something big coming September 9th, seeing as event invites are going out right now, and some sort of large structure is being built for this occasion. Despite all the hype revolving around the upcoming event, one of the most anticipated parts of the whole thing won't be coming for a while, supposedly. According to Re/code, Apple's smart wearable won't be shipping until an unknown date next year. If this report is true, it could mean bad news for Apple overall. The market will likely be much more crowded than it is now by the time the wearable is released, and this may hurt the device’s sales. Re/code also claims that Apple is considering to price the device around $400. This makes this smartwatch more expensive than any other on the market, but there will be multiple models of it. While this is all hearsay until September 9th, the site’s reports regarding Apple release dates have been accurate in the past.

[b][color=white]ISIS Militants Using Consumer Drones for Surveillance[/color][/b]
Technology can be a scary thing sometimes, especially if it gets into the wrong hands. This has become even more apparent after ISIS, the splinter group of Al-Qaeda, used consumer drones for surveillance. A video that was posted to YouTube shows members of Al-Qaeda using the $500 DJI Phantom FC40 to spy on a Syrian airfield, before discussing the information gained from the drone. ISIS reportedly sent in suicide bombers, using the information gathered from the video. The original video of the surveillance has since been removed from YouTube because it displayed execution.  This footage had its strategic use already, and is now a part of a propaganda video. The video itself is meant to show ISIS as high-tech, and still extremely violent, to help bring in more recruits to their cause. While ISIS was already extremely brutal and crafty in their ways, this opens up new possibilities for them. Who knows what will happen next?

[b][color=white]Google Delivery Drones[/color][/b]
Amazon has broken into the market of drone powered delivery, and now it’s Google’s turn with 'Project Wing.' Project Wing is a new endeavor for Google, considering drone delivery services were previously only tested by Amazon. Along with some news on the project, Google has also released a video of how the device would be used practically, which you can see at the end of this article. Project Wing comes from the minds of the same folks who originally developed Project Loon, Google Glass, and Google's driverless cars. The project uses a tail sitter unmanned aircraft, which is like a cross between a plane and a helicopter, which takes off and lands vertically. The drone will fly to a location like a plane and, using rotors, it will then hover over the delivery location and drop the package with a wire attached to it. The device attached to the wire then releases the package and gets pulled back up to the drone itself. The drone service won't be ready for a while, but it is something to keep an eye on. 
If you want to check out the video, click [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cRTNvWcx9Oo]here[/url].
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Amazon Buys Twitch[/color][/b]
This past Monday, Amazon bought Twitch for $970 million. Twitch is a popular and known streaming site where users can broadcast any game they would like to the whole world. Some users stream on Twitch as their full-time job, and others use it to simply interact and play with other people who enjoy doing the same thing. Streamers currently have no insight regarding how Amazon will treat the broadcasting service just yet. Casters and streamers have put up a list stating what they would like Amazon to keep when the new changes take place. CEO of Twitch, Emmett Shear, wrote a letter to the community announcing that he's thankful for all the support that fans send forth. Shear states Amazon is trying to "create tools and services faster than we could have independently." You can read more about the topic on the official blog located [url=http://blog.twitch.tv/2014/08/a-letter-from-the-ceo-august-25-2014/]here[/url]. 

[b][color=white]Nintendo's Two Cents[/color][/b]
A new 3DS model has been announced, which comes with a web filter installed in the browser. In the past, owners have reported seeing inappropriate pictures on their Nintendo 3DS due to purchasing a used device from a store without having the memory cleared. One incident occurred when a young boy received a 3DS and happened to find explicit pictures he shouldn't have seen. In the past, Nintendo set up a system where you can install a filter for 50 cents. The said filter would require you to register a network ID, and would filter out things inappropriate for kids under the age of 13. Nintendo plans on implementing the new filter right away. No need for setup as new devices will already have the filter. To remove the filter, owners will need to pay 30 cents. For safety and protection, Nintendo states this is not to make more money, is a parental setting for those who have no idea what their child can do on the device. Despite the fact that they are only making 30 cents from each 3DS owner (that's if they're willing to pay), if a decent amount of owners paid, Nintendo would make back at least $1.5 million.

[b][color=white]League of Legends Updates[/color][/b]
The beloved MOBA game League of Legends has recently brought to the table various different changes and in-the-work creations. PBE testers have been trying out new upcoming skins, the newest champion, and the updated Summoners Rift. As always, a new skin and champion are currently on sale in the shop. Players will be able to see what's for sale [url=http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/champion-and-skin-sale-0829-0901]here[/url]. This past week, Riot has updated the League of Legends client UI. With World Championships coming up in the near future, Riot is trying their best to make patching as swift as possible. Bug fixes and buffs incoming! The little Yordle we hate and love, Gnar, will be receiving small buffs for improvement on his "feel", developers say. Next, Riot will be implementing a new ranked tier. Players in Diamond and Challenger will be given the rank "Master Tier", if they can remain within the top 200 players. The system will be based on a 24-hour clock schedule, and users will be prompted to fight for their place. In addition to all of this, Riot has announced another champion! Azir, the Emperor of the Sands, has been revealed. You can read more about the Emperor, who originated from the Shurima Desert, [url=http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/champion-reveal/azir-emperor-of-the-sands]here[/url]. Last but not least, Riot Games has put on sale all of the retired legacy skins, as well as a new bundle for some sweet and succulent skins. More about sale can be seen [url=http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/satisfy-your-sweet-tooth-sugar-rush]here[/url].

[b][color=white]Pokkén Tournament Announced[/color][/b]
The Pokemon Company had a pretty big announcement last week, featuring a video game that will feature two of the biggest franchises in video game history. The game, entitled "Pokkén", is an upcoming fighting video game featuring Pokémon which will be developed by the lead producers of Tekken and SoulCalibur, Katsuhiro Harada and Masaaki Hoshino. The announcement came as a shocker for most people, as a collaboration between two completely different studios, let alone two completely different franchises, is a rare occurence. The game is planned to be released for arcade machines, but a console version of the game has not been ruled out by either studio working on the project. Information about the game pretty scarce, but the time frame for the release is stated to be within the next year. Pokkén Tournament is scheduled to be released in Japan arcades sometime within the next year.

[b][color=white]Assassin's Creed Unity Delayed[/color][/b]
Ubisoft's next entry to their popular and critically acclaimed video game series "Assassin's Creed" has been delayed for two weeks to allow their developers to add finishing touches to the game. The game, which was scheduled for an October 28 release, has been pushed back to November 11. Senior Unity producer Vincent Pontbriand said in a statement that "This being a fully next-gen game, it requires a lot of work, a lot of production, and a lot of learning. It's always hard to be precise and to quantify exactly how much work is involved. So as we get close to the finish we often realize we're near the target but we're not quite there yet." Ubisoft has said that the development team will be utilizing the extra time to improve the minor aspects of the game, as well as complete a 'day one' patch that will bring other fixes and improvements to the game. The delay will also mean that both Assassin's Creed Unity and a previous-generation game,"Assassin's Creed Rogue”, will be released on the same day in North America, with both games set to release on November 13 in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. Assassin's Creed Unity will be released on November 11 for the Xbox One, Play Station 4, and PC.

[b][color=white]Rockstar Games Releases 10 more Verified Jobs for Grand Theft Auto Online[/color][/b]
Rockstar released another 10 verified jobs this week for its popular online game, Grand Theft Auto Online. Jobs included are made by the players themselves, and popular game types include Races, Captures, and Death Matches. These are just a few of many jobs created with more to come from their Creator Competition held this past weekend. Following the latest update called the "San Andreas Flight School Update", the next batch of jobs verified by Rockstar will be hand-picked following the last competition, and will be included in the next update to the game. A list provided by [url=http://www.xboxachievements.com/news/news-19100-Grand-Theft-Auto-Online-Gets-Another-10-Verified-Jobs-To-Play.html]Xbox Achievements[/url] can be found in the spoiler below. It provides the name of the jobs, the creators, and a description of the jobs that have been verified and released.

[sp=New GTA Online Verified Jobs]
Code 13-91 (Race) - created by XXChaosiumXX91
For the technical racer that has a penchant for theatrics, this long loop circuit takes place in the heart of Downtown and mixes high speed straights and slalom sections with lots of jumps. Checkpoints become chokepoints as racers weave through well-placed shipping containers and try to muster enough getaway speed to make the next jump - especially when played with a full field of 16 players. This is definitely a Race where it pays to get ahead and stay there, but there are enough hazards and difficult sections to ensure no-one is ever going to get too comfortable.

Urban Jungle (Deathmatch) - created by Ashtargalactic
The single-story houses and yards of South Los Santos are the stage for this close-quarters Team Deathmatch. Rooftops are accessible and allow sneaky players the opportunity to drop down on unsuspecting foes and administer a lethal shotgun blast or melee kill. The map is also bisected by an alley that's been decorated with mixed props to provide cover for players who are brave enough to run end to end. Try exploring vertical space to gain a natural advantage or to sneak around the back of the opposing team.

Rebel Rodeo (Race) - created by NADISNA
Drawing inspiration from Ken Block’s Gymkhana series, NADISNA's creation is one of those Races that's more likely to be decided by what you do with the brake pedal than the accelerator. Skill trumps speed as you slalom, 180 and skid your way around Redwood Lights Track and the surrounding areas of the Grand Senora Desert. We recommend trying this with Non-Contact applied, so you can focus on your own car control and not your opponents' (or their lack thereof).

Brand's Snatch (Race) - created by Seekrit Chimp
The Rockstar Verified collection already features Races inspired by places like Nurburgring, Monaco and Laguna Seca, and this take on the UK's Brand's Hatch circuit continues the trend for recreating famous real world tracks within the confines of Southern San Andreas. Accordingly, this is a high speed Lap Race that separates those who know when to ease off the gas from the drivers who think that driving fast is only about putting your foot down. The roads are wide, so make sure you stick to the racing line, and the Checkpoints are neatly placed so you can focus purely on those apexes. Go with Super or Sports classes and be sure to accelerate out of the chicanes.

Hold: Operation Interrupt (Capture) - created by SoWhack
"A joint operation comprised of the FIB and local PD has just resulted in several bags of drugs being seized in Paleto Bay," reads the description for Operation Interrupt, setting the scene for a standoff in the sand between two teams trying to retrieve the Capture Objects and the heavily-armed Actors there to stop them. Once the bags are in your territory, prepare to fight hard to protect them - or make a foray into enemy territory to steal their stash - all while police cars squeal up and down a narrow stretch of highway running through a busy trucking lane.

Hit The Apex (Race) - created by ZigMeister666
This expansive Lap Race has it all - carefully placed Checkpoints, helpful Props guiding you in the right direction and spectacular views of the Vinewood Sign, Lake Vinewood and Downtown. "Nothing beats the thrill of throwing a fast car around corners at high speeds," reads the description and the default Carbonizzare is certainly a fine choice for sliding down the Vinewood Hills.

Rail Yard, Railed Out (Deathmatch) - created by Jakeperiphery
Regular viewers of the Rockstar Games Twitch channel may remember this Job from our July 11th live stream, created by guitarist slash devoted GTA Online player, Jake Bowen from prog-metal band Periphery. Jake has added props sparingly to maintain the exposed, dangerous middle ground of the train yards, while teams spawn at either end. Stay close to your Crew and resist the urge to hammer the sprint button along the trainyards, as a stealthy approach will yield kills on unsuspecting foes crossing the tracks. Those with a steady aim might want to head to the rooftop, grab the Sniper Rifle and pick off anyone attempting to dash between cover spots.

That's What She Said (Race) - created by Kalweiser
We've found the foundries and tankers of Elysian Island are a relatively underused setting so far among GTA Online creations, so this Race for Sports Cars feels fresh right from the starting grid. A visual theme of decay runs through the course with broken down train carriages, gas cylinders and other industrial detritus littering the trackside. Look out for smaller jumps in and out of the dockyards, a tricky section to enter and exit the train tracks and the final huge leap from the freeway back to the finishing line. And if you enjoy this, have a look through Kalweiser's 67 other Jobs for some more gems.

Raid: Claustrophobia (Capture) - created by DezeWevos
Like the title suggests, this symmetrical arena is a very claustrophobic environment where death is never far away. The near-perfect prop placement also makes this one of the best arena-style Captures we’ve seen so far. If you've got some personal beef that you need to settle, it works very well for 1v1 grudge matches as well. Combat rolls from cover are key to getting the jump on your enemy, and two or three successive kills are necessary to grab a bag and make it back to your base safely. Extra ammo is always close at hand, but health pickups require you to expose yourself on top of the obstacles. Take a breath and try to second-guess your opponent's next move to make sure that you're the cat and not the mouse.

Tittie Twister (Race) - created by xHumbleRx
A dual test of your endurance and your vehicle's suspension, this Race clocks in at over four miles and features huge jump opportunities off cliff faces that tend to thin out the leading pack. The Sanchez is a wise choice here, with its mixture of climbing ability and agility, but be careful not to stack it on the landings.
[/sp]

[b][color=white]Titanfall Update to Feature 8v8 Pilots-Only Playlist[/color][/b]
Titanfall developer Respawn issued the sixth update to its popular shooter Titanfall. The big highlight of this update is a new game mode, an 8v8 which strips titans and robots, allowing for pilot-on-pilot action. Titled "Pilot Skirmish", this new game mode removes those pesky AI robots and the main component of the game, Titans, to make gameplay just like a normal gamer would expect a first-person shooter, similar to Call of Duty and Halo, but with the acrobatics and weapons that are unique to Titanfall. Additional highlights include the addition of the "Marked for Death" game mode, new UI tweaks including one to aid colorblind players, and the ability to earn an "ultra-rare" burn card that allows players to access any of their burn cards at any point during the game. Titanfall's new update is out now for the Xbox One, Xbox 360, and PC.

[b][color=white]New Fish Species Discovered in France[/color][/b]
A team of French ichthyologists has discovered a new species of Pike. The team led by Dr Philippe Keith of the National Museum of Natural History in Paris made the discovery from the Charente to the Adour drainage systems.
According to the team, the new species can exceed 1 meter in total length.
The new species has been named the Aquitanian pike as it was found in Aquitaine.
A pike of 1.37 meters was mentioned by a French scientist in 1853 in Lake Cazeau.

[b][color=white]2,700-Year-Old Phoenician Shipwreck Found near Malta[/color][/b]
A team of Underwater archaeologists led by Dr Timmy Gambin of the University of Malta, claim they have found remains of the sunken Phoenician merchant vessel in the waters off the Maltese island of Gozo.
The Phoenicians were a great maritime people who had developed a high level of ship-building technology.
According to the team the Phoenician shipwreck they discovered at a depth of 125 meters dates to around 700 BC.
The scientists believe that the Phoenician vessel was sailing from Sicily to Malta when it sank.
The vessel is estimated to be around 15 meters in length.

[b][color=white]ZMapp Drug Fully Protects Monkeys Against Ebola [/color][/b]
The experimental drug known as Zmapp which was given to 6 victims of the deadly virus has successfully rescued 18 Monkeys who were injected with the virus.
21 Rhesus macaque were injected with the virus. The remaining 3 who weren't given the drug died.
More than 3,000 people have been infected with Ebola and more than 1,500 have died. 
The World Health Organisation predicts that the outbreak could last another 6 to 9 months and by then the cases could exceed 20,000.

Ukraine and Russia has finally reached a boiling point and they may both declare war against each other. [b][color=white]Pakistan Protesters Clash With Police[/color][/b]
Pakistan protesters have been clashing with the police as they march to the official Islamabad residence of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif. The protesters are anti-government and are marching to the Prime Minister after being told to do so by two separate opposing party leaders. Many fear large scale violence will break out as protesters have been seen wielding axes and baseball bats. Police have so far done their best to prevent the violence with tear gas and other common anti-riot methods but the protesters are staying resilient. So far 264 people have reportedly been injured, including at least 26 policemen. 

[b][color=white]India Economy Booming[/color][/b]
India's economy is booming as the country announces a 5.7% growth in just over three months, which is the quickest pace in two-and-a-half years. The growth was much higher than many analysts were expecting and the main reason for the growth is due to the government changing many policies revolving around businesses. The main change to the policies is tax; the government has tried to minimize tax litigation which means it is now more liable to invest in a business and thus creates a better building block for the economy as a whole.

 A deal where A&E will purchase a ten-percent stake hold in VICE is going to increase VICE's value up to $2.5 billion. Vice would also be producing television shows for A&E's networks. A&E admits the deal was inspired by the hope to gain digital exposure from the large social medium.  Also, another large television network has shown interest in purchasing a ten-percent stake in VICE.  The Time Warner Cable Company has been discussing this with VICE in the past few weeks. Shane Smith, the founder of VICE has visions to turn his network into "the next CNN", and "the next MTV". 

[b][color=white]Malaysian Airlines cuts 6,000 jobs[/color][/b]
In order to cover the $1.9 billion overhaul which was caused by both jet disasters, Malaysian Airlines has to cut over six-thousand workers.  This will cause a 30% staff decrease from the original number of around twenty-thousand working for the airline already. Khazanah Nasional, who owns the largest stake in the company, says the overhaul will cover the fees to start a new airline that will take over the already existing Malaysian Airlines. Khazanah Nasional plans to revive Malaysian Airlines back to profitability by the year 2017, and to have the shares re-listed by the year 2019.  The two tragedies have increased the number of travelers in July 11%  from the year before.

    The International Monetary Fund has agreed to prove $1.5 billion to the troubled nation of Ukraine. The Ukraine economy has been hitting by some significant financial loses due to the trouble with Russian Separatists. In April the IMF approved a $17 billion line of credit to Ukraine, part of a $27 billion international rescue of the economy, but the first releases of funds have yet to stabilize the hryvnia. Arseniy Yatsenyu, who is Ukraine's prime minister, has shown confidence that the economy will stabilize the weakened economy. Arseniy Yatsenyu shared this news via his personal Twitter account.
